title: Entities and Resolution

version_changes.summary: Significant growth in module organization and imports. use statements increased 88% (2874->5399), crate:: paths increased 46% (3525->5145), pub(crate) increased 45% (671->974), pub(super) dramatically increased (49->248).
key_changes: pub use re-exports increased from 232 to 434 (+87%)
pub mod declarations increased significantly (670 instances)

summary: FLS Chapter 14 defines entities, visibility, paths, scopes, namespaces, preludes, use imports, shadowing, and resolution. iceoryx2 v0.8.0 demonstrates comprehensive use of these concepts with expanded module organization due to the restructured crate layout and new FFI layer.

samples_waiver.explanation: This section describes an abstract concept not directly mappable to concrete code patterns

samples.code:
pub(crate) fn new(
    service: Arc<ServiceState<Service, NoResource>>,
    static_config: &StaticConfig,
    config: SubscriberConfig,
samples.purpose: pub(crate) function restricting visibility to current crate for internal port construction
pub(crate) struct with pub(crate) fields for internal event deadline configuration
pub(super) const fn restricting visibility to parent module for BitSet internals

samples.code:
pub(super) has_producer: AtomicBool,
pub(super) has_consumer: AtomicBool,
is_memory_initialized: AtomicBool,
samples.purpose: pub(super) fields for producer/consumer state visible only to parent module

safety_notes: pub(crate) used for internal implementation details
pub(in path) NOT USED - simplifies visibility reasoning
FFI functions are pub(super) - restricted to PAL layer

samples.purpose: Absolute crate:: paths for importing internal types with nested module paths
Relative super:: path for importing from parent module
Grouped use with super:: path and multiple nested paths

findings.description: Declarative macros have textual scope. #[macro_export] for visibility.

samples.purpose: Exported macro with textual scope - visible from point of definition to end of crate
Internal macro with textual scope limited to current module (not #[macro_export])
Exported macro with #[macro_export] extending textual scope to crate root

visibility_layering.description: Strategic use of visibility modifiers for API design
visibility_layering.pattern: pub for API, pub(crate) for internal, pub(super) for submodule sharing, private for implementation

module_organization.description: Hierarchical module structure with clear visibility boundaries

re_export_patterns.description: Re-exporting types from dependencies for API convenience

cross_chapter_references.chapter_4: Types and Traits - type namespace entities
cross_chapter_references.chapter_6: Expressions - path expressions, method calls, field access
cross_chapter_references.chapter_11: Implementations - inherent and trait implementation resolution
cross_chapter_references.chapter_13: Attributes - attribute resolution in macro namespace
cross_chapter_references.chapter_20: Macros - macro namespace and textual macro scope
